docs.snippet: Albert V. Moore, president of Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., returned yesterday on the American Republics liner Uruguay after a two-month business trip to South America. During his tour Mr. Moore conferred with representatives of his company in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Albert V. Moore, president of Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., returned yesterday on the American Republics liner Uruguay after a two-month business trip to South America. During his tour Mr. Moore conferred with representatives of his company in Barbados, Rio de Janeiro, Santos, Sao Paulo, Montevideo, Buenos Aires and Trinidad.
docs.abstract: Returns to N Y C; optimistic on South Amer shipping

headline.main: MOORE OPTIMISTIC ON LATIN SHIPPING; Moore-McCormack President, Back From 2-Month Trip, Finds Field Unexploited SEES GOOD START IN FLEET Shippers of South America 'Want to Do Business With Us,' He Discovers

docs.snippet: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 23.--Miss Pam Barton, the British champion, tempted fate just once too often today in the course of the second and third rounds of the national women's golf championship at the Wee Burn Club.
docs.lead_paragraph: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 23.--Miss Pam Barton, the British champion, tempted fate just once too often today in the course of the second and third rounds of the national women's golf championship at the Wee Burn Club.

headline.main: Miss Glutting Eliminates Miss Barton in Women's National Golf Tournament; DURING MATCH IN WHICH BRITISH CHAMPION WAS BEATEN AT WEE BURN CLUB
